top_categories.workout_context: Whiskey Off-Road’s singletrack, doubletrack demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Whiskey Off-Road isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

Whiskey Off-Road’s classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Whiskey Off-Road’s classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Whiskey Off-Road rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Whiskey Off-Road when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Whiskey Off-Road — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at Whiskey Off-Road intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Whiskey Off-Road. Make this intensity feel like home.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Whiskey Off-Road — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents.
Whiskey Off-Road’s 6,523ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Whiskey Off-Road count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.heat: April in Prescott, Arizona can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Whiskey Off-Road. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Whiskey Off-Road’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Whiskey Off-Road. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Whiskey Off-Road demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: singletrack, doubletrack, gravel roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 50 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 50 miles of classic southwest mtb with singletrack, fire roads, and technical descents in Prescott, Arizona.
